The '''Shadow Folk''', also called the '''''Úvalear''''',<ref name=Fol>{{LT1|X}}, ''The History of the Exiled Gnomes according to the earlier outlines'', p. 237</ref> were the [[fays]] that inhabited [[Hisilómë]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.

After the [[Gnomes]] reached the [[Great Lands]] during their [[Flight of the Noldor|exile]], they had dealings<ref group=note>An earlier text says that the Gnomes had "trouble" with the Shadow Folk, instead.</ref><ref name=Fol/> with the Shadow Folk in Hisilómë, of whom it is said that they were neither "of the [[Valar]] nor of [[Melko]]", and that they came from the primeval [[void]] "when the world was first fashioned".<ref>{{LT1|X}}, ''The History of the Exiled Gnomes according to the later outline'', p. 239</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In the earlier versions of ''The Book of Lost Tales'', the terms "Shadow Folk" and "shadow-folk" were names given in fear by [[Men]] to the [[Ilkorindi|Lost Elves]] who inhabited Hisilómë before their arrival.<ref>{{LT1|V}}, p. 119</ref>
